definition: audition/dress rehearsal/preview (of a theatrical performance)/dummy run
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act

sentences.english: I’m looking at scripts and auditioning.
sentences.chinese: 我也盼着其它的好剧本和试演机会。

sentences.english: Show that does well in the tryouts in the provinces is likely to be sold out weeks in advance .
sentences.chinese: 在外埠试演成功的戏大概几个星期以前票就卖完了。

sentences.english: The programme was given a trial run to gauge viewers' reactions.
sentences.chinese: 该节目进行了试演以了解观众的反应。

sentences.english: The next day turned out to be super lucky. My audition couldn’t have gone better.
sentences.chinese: 第二天运气更好，我的试演好极了。

sentences.english: At every audition, I was growing more and more self-conscious of my height.
sentences.chinese: 每场试演会都让我变得越来越在意自己的身高。

sentences.english: She's trying out for the part of Cleopatra.
sentences.chinese: 她正在试演克娄巴特拉这个角色。

sentences.english: Acting auditions are an important step in landing an acting job.
sentences.chinese: 试演是在降落的表演工作的重要一步。

sentences.english: I'm sorry, I have an audition.
Actor Mark Hamill auditioned for and received a voice role in the film.
sentences.chinese: 演员马克哈米尔试演，并获得了在电影中的角色配音。

sentences.english: Readers in a Broadway play audition are people who read the opposite character lines.
sentences.chinese: 在百老汇戏剧试演一个人谁读读者对面的线条。

sentences.english: The producer plans to audition dancers tomorrow morning.
sentences.chinese: 导演计划明天上午让舞蹈演员试演。

sentences.english: The director is trying out some actors for the new play.
sentences.chinese: 导演为那个新戏正请几位演员试演。

sentences.english: They auditioned him for a part in the play.
sentences.chinese: 他们让他试演剧中的一个角色。

sentences.english: I'm auditioning for a part in the play tomorrow, and I hope I get it.
sentences.chinese: 明天我在那个剧里试演一个角色，我希望能录取。

sentences.english: I learned for a year and then I passed an audition to get in the conservatory of music in Bordeaux.
sentences.chinese: 学了一年后我就通过了波尔多音乐学院的试演。

sentences.english: The play is due to be previewed tonight.

definition: to act (in a play)/to perform/to put on (a performance)/performance/concert/show/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]
to face the enemy/to meet an attack
(of a play, movie etc) to begin
to work for a trial period/worker on probation
opera highlights performed as independent pieces
to open a furnace/to start up a furnace
to have a competition/to measure with one's hand or arm/to make a gesture of measuring
